content: Can someone explain to me the main difference between FHIR specification and SMART on FHIR APIs? Please.

"SMART on FHIR, provides a health app interface based on open standards including HL7’s FHIR, OAuth2, and OpenID Connect. FHIR provides a detailed set of “core” data models" - https://smarthealthit.org/smart-on-fhir-api/

So if I have to develop an app for any user to track their medical records as well as share it to any hospital/clinic s/he might visit next. So should it be built with SMART if yes why and what benefits it adds or is it possible to built it using FHIR specification only?
Have a read through of the site I sent, it will answer your question
If you have specific questions regarding SMART, best ask them in the #smart channel
